result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Okon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full - bond previously posted has been applied.
Defendant to undergo a Psychological Evaluation as deemed appropriate by supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any firearms.

DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. The Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the Jennings 22 caliber pistol.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Okon

defendant.name: Okon, Richard J
defendant.address: N2947 County Road E; PO Box 551, Redgranite, WI 54970

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 1:59 p.m. Defendant Richard J Okon in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Sulewski. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: 15 days WC Jail - Huber, No GT, 3 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than June 1, 2016, DAAP and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Psych evaluation as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, No possession of any firearms, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge, Jennings 22 caliber pistol ordered forfeited and destroyed. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Richard J Okon in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Sulewski requests plea/sentencing about 30 days out.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Richard J Okon in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sulewski requesting another STC as he was recently appointed to the case.  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 09:15 am.

1:50 pm case called. Defendant Richard J Okon in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician and unless possessing that substance in the quantity of that prescription.  No possession of any firearms and/or dangerous weapons.

Case Called @ 1:15 PM:  Defendant Richard J Okon in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Richard J Okon in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   SPD has not yet determined eligibility - further information required.   ADA argues as to cash bond of $1000.00.  Argument as to bond by SPD - lower cash or signature bond.  The Court:  Orders cash bond is appropriate of $1000.00 with conditions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
